business.headline: Explained: Why Warren Buffett warned that US Dollar could be 'going to hell'The remarks reflected deeper concerns Buffett has long harboured: America's swelling deficit, a growing culture of bureaucratic inefficiency, and the rising use of trade policy as a political weapon.

Who is Greg Abel, Warren Buffett's heir to Berkshire's $1.18 trillion empire?Greg Abel, who has served as vice chairman overseeing Berkshire's sprawling non-insurance operations, has been a trusted Warren Buffett lieutenant for over a decade.

Warren Buffett bows out with stark dollar warning: Currency going to hellWarren Buffett, who officially handed over the CEO reins to Vice Chairman Greg Abel at the meeting, indicated that a significant investment in a European country could prompt Berkshire to conduct more financing in foreign currencies.

Warren Buffett to step down as Berkshire CEO, Greg Abel to take overWarren Buffett, 94, said that he will step down as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway at the end of 2025 and hand over the reins to Vice Chairman Greg Abel.

India bans all imports from Pakistan in response to Pahalgam terror attackIn a strong response to the Pahalgam terror attack, India has banned both direct and indirect imports from Pakistan and denied Pakistani ships access to Indian ports. Although direct imports were minimal, some goods were entering through third-party countries.

India bans imports from Pak, bars port access in tough moves post PahalgamThe move comes after India announced the closure of the Attari-Wagah land border following the Pahalgam attack, crippling bilateral trade.
Mutual funds are on the rise again. Check out these 5 bets in 2025Choosing the right mutual fund depends on how much risk you're comfortable with and how long you plan to invest.

Oyo delays IPO attempt for 3rd time as largest shareholder opposes: ReportIndia's Nifty 50 index has risen about 3% in 2025 so far, but it's still over 7% below its all-time high from October last year. This market volatility has affected several companies.

UPI witnesses small dip in April, but yearly growth remains strongAccording to data from the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI processed 17.89 billion transactions in April, which is about 2.2% less than March's 18.30 billion.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".
Sensex ends 260 points higher, Nifty above 24,300; Adani Ports gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 259.75 points to close at 80,501.99, while the NSE Nifty50 ended just 12.50 points higher at 24,346.70.
Zoho halts $700 million chip manufacturing plan. Here's whyZoho, started in 1996, is known for offering affordable business software and services to companies around the world.

Vizhinjam port inaugurated: What makes it a strategic gem for IndiaThe Vizhinjam port has a natural sea depth of around 20 metres, making it suitable for very large ships without the need for deep digging, which is common in other ports.

UPI payments to get faster from June 16: What it means for youNPCI shared in its latest circular stated that from June 16, 2025, UPI users can expect quicker responses when checking the status of a transaction or reversing a payment.

Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.

Zomato shares rise despite 78% drop in Q4 profit. Should you buy, hold or sell?Eternal posted revenue of Rs 5,830 crore, broadly in line with analyst estimates. EBITDA margin slipped to 1.2%—falling short of expectations—but the company managed to maintain stable contribution margins in both food delivery and quick commerce.
Adani Group stocks rise up to 5%. Here's whyAdani Enterprises' shares climbed more than 2% on Friday after the company reported an increase in its net profit for the January–March quarter.
Sensex gains 900 points. 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 867.48 points at 81,109.72 around 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 247.90 points to trade at 24,582.10.

Sensex, Nifty soar as trade deal hopes lift sentiment; FII buying boosts rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex went past the 81,000 mark while NSE Nifty50 was close to surpassing 24,600 level as Dalal Street surged in early trade.

Ather Energy IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateThe total number of bids received was 7,67,49,068 against the offer of 5,11,22,370 shares. Through the IPO, Ather Energy raised Rs 2,980.76 crore.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty rise or fall on May 2?In the last two sessions, both Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower. There was uncertainty among investors due to rising tension between India and Pakistan. However, markets are expected to start the day on a stronger note.

Stocks to watch: Eternal, Tata Motors, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, MahindraBoth the Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower in the last session, as cautious sentiment prevailed among investors over rising India-Pakistan tension.

Air India expects $600 million in losses if Pak airspace shut for a year: ReportThe closure of Pakistani airspace for a year would result in losses of USD 600 million for the country's national carrier, Air India, news agency PTI reported, citing sources. The airline has sought the government's assistance to address the challenges.

RBI makes PRAVAAH portal mandatory for financial institutions starting May 1The PRAVAAH portal provides all necessary forms, along with simple instructions. Users can submit their application, track its progress, and even get alerts.
GST collections hit record Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April, up 12.6%In March, GST collections stood at Rs 1.96 lakh crore, showing a 9.9% rise from the same period last year.

Nithin Kamath exposes this scam using his name to dupe investors. Details hereZerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has urged investors to stay alert, always check the source, and never act on random financial advice sent on messaging apps.

Adani Ports Q4 results: Net profit soars 50%, revenue up 23%The company reported a 50% rise in its consolidated net profit, which stood at Rs 3,023 crore. This is an increase from Rs 2,025 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

From ATM charges to LPG prices: 5 key financial changes to know in May 2025Starting May 1, taking cash out from an ATM after your free monthly limit will cost you Rs 23 per transaction, up from the current Rs 21.
Zomato Q4 earnings: What to expect from Eternal's January-March resultsAnalysts expect mixed numbers for the fourth quarter, mainly due to expected higher losses from its quick commerce arm, Blinkit.

'Gold doesn't always glitter': This CA's post might change your mindA CA pointed out a combination of global shocks, like COVID-19, wars, inflation fears, and central bank purchases, which all contributed to the price spike in the yellow metal since 2020.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

Ather Energy IPO: Step-by-step guide to check allotment status. See latest GMPThe electric scooter maker's public offer was just fully subscribed by the end of the final day of bidding, suggesting investors were not keen to put their money on another EV scooter maker, after Ola Electric's shares have not performed well since its market debut.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Sensex, Nifty holiday: Are stock markets open for trading today?There are also no market holidays in the months of June and July 2025, so investors can expect uninterrupted trading during this period.

After Mother Dairy, Amul hikes milk prices by Rs 2 per litreAfter Mother Dairy, Amul has also hiked the prices of its milk up to 2rs per litre. The new prices will come into effect from tomorrow, i.e., May 1.

'Cash is king,' says Mark Mobius amid trade war fears, backs India over ChinaVeteran investor Mark Mobius believes that the uncertainty around the trade wars makes it risky to invest right now. However, he does see hope in countries like India, which he says could benefit as global supply chains shift away from China.
Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 46.14 points to end at 80,242.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 1.75 points to close at 24,334.20.

entertainment.headline: BTS's V and Jungkook flaunt military muscles in gym photos, takes internet by stormBTS members Taehyung and Jungkook were seen flaunting their ripped arms in recently surfaced photos. The image has sparked excitement among fans as the duo prepares for their military discharge.

Babil Khan's team clarifies 'widely misinterpreted' clips, assures his safetyBabil Khan's team issued a statement and addressed his now-deleted viral emotional videos. The team clarified that the actor's comments were 'widely misinterpreted and taken out of context.'

Saif Ali Khan clarifies Taimur remark: Apologised for being the evil villainSaif Ali Khan recently clarified his recent comment about apologising to son, Taimur, after making him watch 'Adipurush.' The actor stated that he apologised to his son for playing the evil villain.

HIT 3 vs Retro box office Day 3: Nani's film races past Suriya's thrillerThis week's South releases - Nani's 'HIT: The Third Case' and Suriya's 'Retro' - opened strong at the box office. However, the Telugu thriller has pulled ahead of the Tamil actioner in terms of collections.

Dharmendra meets 'lovely co-star' Jaya Prada, fans say 'two legends in one frame'Veteran actors Dharmendra and Jaya Prada's reunion delighted fans. The two have worked together in films like 'Qayamat', 'Insaaf Kaun Karega' and 'Ganga Tere Desh Mein', among others.

Sonu Nigam breaks silence on concert row: Was threatened by a group of boysSinger Sonu Nigam recently shared a video and addressed the controversy surrounding his Bengaluru concert. He revealed being threatened by a group of boys to sing in Kannada.

Dhanush surprises fans at AR Rahman's Mumbai concert, perform Adangaatha AsuranIn a delightful surprise, actor Dhanush took to the stage at AR Rahman's concert in Mumbai, leaving fans ecstatic. He performed 'Adangaatha Asuran' from his film 'Raayan', adding to the evening's excitement.

Raid 2 box office Day 3: Ajay Devgn film surpasses Drishyam 2 early collectionAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' released in theatres on May 1 amid much anticipation. The sequel to the 2018 hit film has earned almost Rs 50 crore in its first weekend.

Hania Aamir reacts as Indian fans use VPN to get access to her InstagramPakistani actor Hania Aamir recently reacted to Indian fans who revealed using a VPN to get access to her Instagram. This comes after India geo-blocked the Instagram accounts of several well-known Pakistani celebrities.

Aamir Khan-Gauri Spratt visit Boney Kapoor, offer condolences after mother's deathAamir Khan and his girlfriend Gauri Spratt recently visited Boney Kapoor to offer their condolences following the funeral of his mother, Nirmal Kapoor. The couple was seen at Boney Kapoor's residence, expressing their support during this difficult time.

Diljit Dosanjh confirms his MET Gala debut, says 'first time' in new postIt is official! Singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh is all set to make his debut at MET Gala 2025. He would be joined by Shah Rukh Khan, Kiara Advani and Priyanka Chopra.

SRK arrives in New York for MET Gala debut, greets fans at airportShah Rukh Khan has finally reached New York for his much-anticipated MET Gala debut this year. A video from his arrival at the airport is going viral, of him greeting fans.

Baazi: Where noir meets nonsense in Dev Anand and Guru Dutt's early experimentBaazi, a 1951 Bollywood film directed by Guru Dutt, showcases Dev Anand's charm. Despite its absurd ending, it remains a box-office classic with a unique cinematic style.

Ram Charan cheers for 'dear brother' Nani after HIT 3's successTollywood star Ram Charan is the latest to join the chorus of praise for Nani's latest film, 'HIT: The Third Case'. On Saturday, he shared a note congratulating the cast and crew of the Telugu action-thriller.

Thalaivan Thalaivii: Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen's film gets a titleActors Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen's upcoming movie has been titled 'Thalaivan Thalaivii'. The title teaser was shared on May 3.

Mira Rajput felt 'isolated' marrying Shahid Kapoor at 20: Was occupied, caught upMira Rajput recently opened up about marrying Shahid Kapoor at the age of 20. She admitted to feeling isolated at times and confessed that she longed for the kind of life her friends were living during that phase.

Kapil Sharma flaunts stunning transformation in new video, celebs and fans reactKapil Sharma has been impressing fans with his remarkable weight-loss transformation. On Saturday, the comedian shared a video of himself running through the hills, drawing reactions from both celebrities and fans alike.

Panchayat 4 teaser: It's Pradhan Ji vs Bhushan in high-stakes Phulera electionThe teaser of the much-awaited season four of Prime Video's 'Panchayat' is out. The upcoming season will premiere in July.

Kim Soo-hyun's agency files fresh complaint against YouTuber Kim Se-euiKorean actor Kim Soo-hyun's agency has filed a fresh complaint against YouTuber Kim Se-eui for spreading false information about the actor. The agency issued a statement and detailed the complaint.

general news.headline: India looking for partners, not preachers: Jaishankar takes a dig at EuropeAnswering a question about India's expectations from Europe, Dr S Jaishankar said that it has to get beyond preaching. He asserted India's support for both Russian and American realism and said that Europe must start acting based on a framework of mutuality of interests.

Air India flight to Tel Aviv diverted over missile attack, airline suspends opsA Houthi missile strike near Tel Aviv's Ben Gurion Airport on Sunday caused an Air India flight from Delhi to divert to Abu Dhabi, also prompting the airline to immediately suspend all Tel Aviv operations until May 6.

PM meets Air Chief Marshal amid rising tensions with Pak over Pahalgam attackAir Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh met Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his official residence in Delhi amid rising tensions with Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 people, on April 22.

Pak can fight war only for 4 days, struggling with shortage of artilleries: ReportThe Pakistani military, anticipating a possible Indian strike in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, has a severe shortage of critical artillery ammunition and can fight a war for just four days, news agency ANI reported, citing sources.

Babil Khan's team clarifies 'widely misinterpreted' clips, assures his safetyBabil Khan's team issued a statement and addressed his now-deleted viral emotional videos. The team clarified that the actor's comments were 'widely misinterpreted and taken out of context.'

KKR vs RR Live: Moeen Ali traps YashasviJaiswalIPL 2025, KKR vs RR Live Updates: Rajasthan Royals have been rocked early as they lost two wickets within the first two overs as Kunal Singh Rathore and Vaibhav Suryavanshi have been dismissed cheaply in their 207 chase.

Video: Shopkeeper attacked with blade by girl over refusing to take back itemsIn the CCTV footage of the attack, a girl aged around 15 is seen attacking a man with a blade before a nearby woman swiftly intervenes and restrains her.

Will go to England if war breaks out with India: Pakistani MP in viral videoSher Afzal Khan Marwat, a member of Pakistan's National Assembly, was responding to a reporter who asked if he would go to the border with a gun in case of war with India. Marwat replied, "I will go to England if war breaks out with India."

Bhoota Kola: Dance of spirits beyond barriers of caste and timeBhoota Kola, a centuries-old ritualistic art practice of the Tulu people of coastal Karnataka and Kerala, is unique because it assigns roles to people from across castes and communities. People from lower castes turn into deities and oracles, and are worshipped by all. 'Dance of spirits' events are held from November to May every year.

Happy to take responsibility: Rahul Gandhi's reply to Sikh man on 1984 riotsThe moment marks one of Rahul Gandhi's clearest acknowledgements of historical wrongs committed by his party, amid continuing calls for accountability and justice from India's Sikh community.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi out for 3 after Ajinkya Rahane takes stunning catchIPL 2025: Ajinkya Rahane's brilliant running catch to dismiss Vaibhav Suryavanshi added to the 14-year-old's struggles, as concerns grow over the pressure on the teenage star following his record-breaking IPL century against GT.

Will use full spectrum of power: Pak envoy's nuke threat to India amid tensionsPakistan's Ambassador to Russia Muhammad Khalid Jamali has threatened that his country will use nuclear weapons on India if New Delhi launches a military action on the neighbouring country.

Sonu Nigam breaks silence on concert row: Was threatened by a group of boysSinger Sonu Nigam recently shared a video and addressed the controversy surrounding his Bengaluru concert. He revealed being threatened by a group of boys to sing in Kannada.

India conducts maiden flight-trials of stratospheric airship platformIndia successfully conducted the maiden flight-trials of its Stratospheric Airship Platform, developed by the Agra-based Aerial Delivery Research and Development Establishment, on May 3.

Rahul Gandhi calls Lord Ram 'mythological', BJP hits back with 'anti-Hindu' jibeBJP leaders lashed out at Rahul Gandhi for calling Lord Ram a mythological figure while speaking at Brown University in the US.

CBSE Class 10, 12 results 'not announced,' clarifies board on fake letterCBSE has officially clarified that the date for the Class 10 and 12 board exam results has not yet been declared. This comes in response to a fake letter dated May 2, 2025, that has been circulating on social media, claiming to announce the result date.

Actor Sean Penn likens Trump to spouse killer: May destroy world before he goesActor Sean Penn has compared US President Donald Trump to a "jealous spouse who murders another partner" and warned that he may "try to destroy the world" if his third-term ambitions were not fulfilled.

3-year-old with tumour dies after Jain 'fast unto death' enforced by parentsHer parents, who work as Information Technology (IT) professionals, say that they decided to make their daughter take the Santhara vow after being advised by a Jain muni (monk).

Pakistani journalists clash at London cafe, abuse each other in viral clipA video has gone viral showing two Pakistani journalists involved in a shouting match at a cafe in London and abusing each other.

Warren Buffett bows out with stark dollar warning: Currency going to hellWarren Buffett, who officially handed over the CEO reins to Vice Chairman Greg Abel at the meeting, indicated that a significant investment in a European country could prompt Berkshire to conduct more financing in foreign currencies.

Imran Khan, Bilawal Bhutto's X accounts blocked in India after Pahalgam attackThis development comes in the wake of the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 people were killed after terrorists from The Resistance Force (TRF), an offshoot of the banned Pakistani terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), opened fire on civilians.

3 dead, several trapped after battered building collapses at Jharkhand hospitalJharkhand Health Minister Irfan Ansari visited the site on the instructions of Chief Minister Hemant Soren and said, "Our priority is to stand with the families of the deceased".

Married Pak woman after getting nod from CRPF headquarters: Dismissed jawanA Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) jawan, who was dismissed from service for allegedly concealing his marriage to a Pakistani woman, said he got married to her only after receiving prior approval from CRPF headquarters.

Yash Dayal's father credits Virat Kohli for transforming his son's careerYash Dayal's father, Chanderpal Dayal, has credited star India batter Virat Kohli for transforming his son's career at Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). Dayal defended 15 runs in the final over vs Chennai Super Kings (CSK) while bowling against MS Dhoni and Shivam Dube.

IPL 2025: MS Dhoni's crisp praise to Ayush Mhatre's champion 94 vs RCBIPl 2025: Seventeen-year-old Ayush Mhatre lit up the IPL with a stunning 94 against RCB, earning high praise from MS Dhoni, who called him a "champion" after CSK's narrow 2-run defeat at Chinnaswamy.

KKR vs RR: Kolkata bring in Moeen Ali and Ramandeep Singh for all-important clashKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) made a couple of changes to their playing XI as they brought in Moeen Ali and Ramandeep Singh for their fixture against Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
